title: Assassin Update/Pre Season
body: I was wondering if a rioter would be able to discuss when the assassin reworks will be hitting the PBE and if the preseason is coming along with it? It should either be on 6.22 PBE or 6.23 PBE and I was wondering if maybe we could get an estimation on whether we will see it in a week or in 3 weeks time and if they come out at the same time?

replies.body: The plan is for the assassin reworks to be part of the pre-season patch (6.22). That will hopefully hit the PBE next week. 6.22 will likely be on the PBE a bit longer than usual. We'll probably do 3 weeks between 6.21 and 6.22, in part to give some extra testing time.

Coooool
Also wanted to ask which exact items (if there is an accurate list of them) will be modified for the assassin update

Still working on exact changes, though Ghostblade, Duskblade and Maw will definitely be in there. Probably looking at major changes to only half a dozen items or so this time, this'll be a smaller set of item changes than previous class updates. 

There'll be a few changes to non AD items as well. Aegis will lose its aura for example but still exists as a Locket component, with a couple of new support items to fill the gap it leaves. Rylai's will get some changes too, though those might get delayed a patch or two if we don't hit on the appropriate version in time for 6.22.

Just chiming in, hope you don't mind.

You did mention health being too universal a stat on Rylais seeing that everyone who could use AP would be able to buy it.
But isn't that necessarily a bad thing?
Rylais should be an option for Magic damage dealers, its universal stats made you able to pick it up whenever you thought you needed the bulk and utility.

WOuldn't giving it Mana/CDR somewhat skew with this?

Also, I heard that Rylais would get nerfed regardless, which is the right call.
Is slow strength one of the factors you'll be chipping down, because let's be honest 40% AoE slows is a bit strong, huh?^^

Anyways, can't wait to get specifics, I'm thinking about it way too much anyways seeing that it's a core part of Morde's build
And so the silence begins.

I really like Riot's approach to player communication which allows us as developers to just talk directly to you folks. It still takes time though that comes at the expense of actually making the game. If your expectations are for daily updates on everything in development, most of which will be 'still working on it', then my apologies, but we won't be meeting those expectations. Spending a decent amount of time on communication's really valuable, there's a point though where, if you don't have something new to say, you're paying a cost in progress elsewhere to offer little.

I think you're doing a great job actually, so that's something.

http://img14.deviantart.net/2c92/i/2015/347/0/5/morde_cookies_by_nimrohd-d9k00sj.jpg

This is totally not a way to bribe you into not making Rylais a Mana item, what are you guys even thinking?!
My motives are pure

Will there be a preseason info site like midseason? I'm eager to see the the break down of changes to the assassins as well as whatever else is changing.

Also, in your opinion, will this preseason be as much of a dramatic change as last preseason?

Yup, we'll have a site that summarizes the changes.

In terms of amount of change I personally feel there's a lot in this pre-season. It's a wider spread of gameplay and non gameplay than in the past though, so rather than all being champion/item/map changes there's other really significant stuff coming at or around the same time (e.g. new client, return of Duo/Solo queue, replays, etc).

You said that in pre-season you will look into farming being more effective than roaming. I watch Worlds right now and farming is being prioritized way more, leading to very low kill games. Will you have changes regarding that aspect of the game?

Not at this time. We did test some changes that would have shifted gold/XP from farming to other sources. Concern was that they potentially made the game noticeably more snowbally at a time where we expected a lot of assassins to be played (a class that takes advantage of snowball extremely well, in a more frustrating than most manner). We decided not to make those changes as a result, depending on how things pan out though it's possible we might revisit them for mid-season.

Will Maw be less oppressive to AP mages, or will it be just something easier to deal with?  It gets rather frustrating for me to not be able to kill an AD champion because Maw pops and it gives them that little edge to overcome my Ryze W E Q E Q E E Q E Q combo.    Lel; PS has anyone found out how to do the E E E Q 1.6k minimum damage combo?

It will be less oppressive if it's only bought by fighters (like Darius and Jarvan), champions that the item was originally intended for. If you take away stuff like the flat armorpen, then you won't have to worry about the likes of Zed or Talon building it midlane while maintaining kill pressure against you.
